{"step_by_step_thinking": "Nephrocalcinosis is defined by calcium phosphate or calcium oxalate deposits in the kidney parenchyma. Medullary nephrocalcinosis can be caused by a variety of etiologies. Hyperoxaluria is mentioned as a cause of medullary nephrocalcinosis in Document [0]. Bartter's syndrome is also mentioned as a cause of medullary nephrocalcinosis in Document [1] and Document [10]. Prolonged use of furosemide is mentioned as a cause of medullary nephrocalcinosis in Document [11] and Document [23]. However, ARPKD (Autosomal Recessive Polycystic Kidney Disease) is not mentioned in any of the documents as a cause of medullary nephrocalcinosis. ARPKD is characterized by the development of cysts in the kidneys, not calcium deposits.", "answer_choice": "D. ARPKD"}
